title: Calm in the Chaos
author: Anonymous
content:
In the midst of a huge nowhere,
Chaos once reigns, wild and bare.
Where fighting is inevitable, raw and loud,
And nothing of value walks unbowed.

But within its darkness lay something still,
A space untouched by the world’s ill will.
Silence and calm, where truth holds tight,
Even as wrong screams loud in the night.

And within that something lays you,
A quiet queen with grace shining through.
Where home is peace, not frantic pace,
A steady light in a broken place.

Your presence weaves calm through storm and flame,
A whispered prayer, a sacred name.
You turn the mess to meaning deep,
And wake the lost from shattered sleep.

So while the world may tear and fall,
You stand unmoved, above it all.
The heart’s safe haven, soft and true—
This universe of calm begins with you.

title: Love at first sight
author: Anonymous
content:
I saw thee once, and in that glance,
The world did pause, as if by chance.
The air grew still, the heavens bent—
And beauty spoke with sweet intent.

Thine eyes, twin stars in twilight's sea,
Outshone the moon that looked on me.
A gaze that danced yet held me fast,
A fleeting look, forever cast.

Thy hair, like night with sun entwined,
Did tempt both art and poet’s mind.
Each strand a thread of gold’s pure grace,
Each breeze entranced to touch thy face.

Thy form, the shape of nature’s song,
Where every line did right no wrong.
A living sculpture, soft and bright,
The muse that haunts both dream and night.

Thy voice—ah, music's sweetest kin,
Did echo deep beneath my skin.
It called to me with siren's might,
And led my heart without a fight.

I fell not slow, but swift and sure,
No logic sought, no need to cure.
For what is man 'gainst beauty's flame,
But ash that gladly speaks her name?

And though time's tide may wash away,
The place I fell remains today.
For beauty such as thine imparts,
A mark eternal on men's hearts.

title: Why Thou Art Missing
author: Anonymous
content:
When thou art gone where duty lies,
And leave me 'neath the watching skies,
The sun grows dim, the air turns cold—
A tale of absence, softly told.

Thy place once filled with light and cheer
Now whispers low, 'She is not here.'
The air still holds thy vanished grace,
Yet longs in vain to see thy face.

In sacred halls where prayers ascend,
Thou art as flame the clouds attend.
I sit in hush and silent gaze,
While thou dost shine through holy praise.

Among the rows where souls do sing,
Thou movest like an angel's wing.
Yet though the hymn flows full and wide,
I feel the ache where thou dost bide.

And in the room where minds are fed,
Where thoughts are drawn and lectures led,
I find my eyes betray their task,
For where thou art is all I ask.

A glance, a turn, a fleeting grace—
It burns its shape in time and space.
And every step thou takest near,
Leaves echoes deep when thou'st not here.

So while the world may turn its page,
And hours pass in saint or sage,
Still doth my soul in quiet plea,
Await the hour thou return’st to me.

title: Gakos Tani
author: Anonymous
content:
Gakos tani ikaw subong,
Sa tunga sang ulan ukon adlaw nga mainit.
Indi na ko magpangita pa sang iban,
Basta ara ka lang, duol kag init.

Ginhawa ko naga hulat sang imo,
Kalma siya basta mahaplas mo ang likod ko.
Lipay siya basta matandog ko ang buhok mo,
Kag maghigda lang ta, wala sang plano.

Isa ka lang ka gakos, mabugnaw na ang adlaw,
Indi gid ya mabakal ni bisan sin-o.
Biskan ginakapoy ang kalibutan,
Nami gid ya ang pahway sa imo tupad.

Ginahandom ko ang imo dughan,
Bilang halik sang kalinong sa akon duta.
Sa imo dughan, ara ang puluy-an ko,
Wala sang kasakit nga makapalapit.

Pagduol mo palang gani,
Nagapadali na ang tagipusuon ko.
Abi ko bala may bomba nga gamay,
Pero halok lang gali sang gugma mo.

Tani karon pa lang, ara na ko dira,
Gapungko sa tupad mo nga tahimik lang.
Basi kapoy ka na sang tanan nga butang,
Ako na lang maggakos sa imo sang bug-os nga kalibutan.

Ikaw bala, ginabatyagan mo man?
Nga ako ya, halos magutok ang dughan.
Ginakulbaan ko kung indi mo mabatian,
Nga ginahandom ko ang init sang imo lawas.

Gakos tani ikaw, bisan wala ta pulong,
Kay ang lawas ta na ang nagahambal.
Sa isa ka gakos, ako nangin buhi,
Kag ang adlaw, indi na madulom liwat.

title: Mainit nga Gugma
author: Anonymous
content:
Sa imo lang gid ako nagahinay-hinay,
Sa tanang gab-i, damgo ikaw permi ang ginabay.
Mainit nga ginahandom, indi ko malikawan,
Lawas ko kag imo, daw pareho naga pangita-anay.

Ang panulok mo, kalayo sa tagipusuon,
Ginahingabot ako sang handum nga indi ko masugpon.
Kung maglapit ka, daw may ginabati nga kilat,
Ginapasipala ang kalinong, ginaguba sang gulat.

Gusto ko ikaw, indi lang sa hunahuna,
Kundi sa tanan nga butang nga pwede naton malukpan pa.
Ang palad mo sa akon panit, halong kag init,
Gina-uyatan ko ang hangin nga may dala nga pulong nga malipit.

Sa tunga sang pagpugong, may halong pagpadayon,
Duha ta ka lawas, ginapalibutan sang kahimtangan nga nagapungpong.
Indi kinahanglan sang pulong, ginabasa na ang mata,
Ang gugma ta, hilom pero puno sang balatyagon nga palapad nga katahum.

title: Gugma Ko Sa Imo
author: Anonymous
content:
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo mata nga nagasidlak,
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo mga ngisi nga nagahatag sang kalipay.
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo mga buhok nga nagahuyop sa hangin,
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo tingog nga nagapahamtang sang kalma sa akon.

Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo palanggaon nga panghunahuna,
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo kamot nga mahumok kag mahigugmaon.
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo pagpalangga nga wala sang katapusan,
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo mga damgo nga ginahandum ko man.

Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo pagkahamtong nga nagahatag sang kasiguraduhan,
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo pagpalangga bisan sa mga kalisod.
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo katahum nga nagasiga pareho sang adlaw,
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo pagtuo nga nagapabakod sang aton gugma.

Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo kahanginan nga nagahatag sang kinabuhi,
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo mga halakhak nga nagapahilum sang kasubo.
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo pagpasensya kag pag-antos para sa aton,
Palangga ko ikaw, sa tanan nga ginahimo mo para sa akon kag sa aton.

Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo paghangop sang akon mga kahinaan,
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo pagpakigbahin sang imo mga kalipay kag kasubo.
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo nga pagin kaupod ko sa tanan nga adlaw,
Palangga ko ikaw, sang sobra pa sa pulong nga mabutang ko.

Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo mga mata nga nagasugid sang mga tinago,
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo dughan nga nagaduyog sang akon mga damgo.
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo pagsunod sang mga handum naton,
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo nga pagpadayon bisan sang madamo nga pagsulay.

Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo halad nga gugma nga wala sang paglubad,
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo mga hilikoton nga ginahimo para sa aton kalipay.
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo kabug-usan nga ginapakita sa akon adlaw-adlaw,
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo kaugalingon nga ginapalangga ko gid.

Palangga ko ikaw, indi lang tungod sa imo mga kahimtang,
Palangga ko ikaw, kundi tungod ikaw ang ginahandom ko sa gihapon.
Palangga ko ikaw, bisan ano pa man ang matabo sa kalibutan,
Palangga ko ikaw, sa gihapon kag sa kadayunan.

Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo ngalan nga akon ginabatyagan,
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo kahimtang nga ginahalinan sang akon paglaum.
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo paghigugma nga nagahatag sang kusog,
Palangga ko ikaw, sa tanan nga rason nga indi ko matandog.

Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo mga ginhawa nga ginahuyop ko sa dughan,
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo presensya nga nagahatag sang kahulugan.
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo kalipay nga akon ginahalinan,
Palangga ko ikaw, nga ikaw lang ang ginahigugma ko sang tuman.

Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo mga pulong nga nagapalip-ot sang akon kalibutan,
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo pag-ako sang akon mga sala kag kahuyang.
Palangga ko ikaw, sa imo nga nagapadayon sa pag-upod sa akon,
Palangga ko ikaw, sa gihapon, sa gihapon, kag sa gihapon.

title: Failing in Success
author: Anonymous
content:
We met in a game where falling was the rule,
A week to act like lovers, trying not to lose.
Falling step by step, pretending hearts would beat,
Two strangers playing parts, unsure if real or feat.

Day one was just a laugh, a tease in the air,
We joked and faked the closeness, caught unaware.
Day two brought quiet moments, sparks that wouldn’t fade,
Pretending felt too real, no longer just charade.

By day three, the game was done, we dropped the play,
From acting to believing, our hearts found their way.
No more just for a week, no rules to confine,
What started as a game, turned truly yours and mine.

We failed the game but won so much more,
In a world of pretending, we found the core.
From falling in a game to standing side by side,
A love unplanned, but one we can’t hide.

title: Pinakamasayang Pangarap
author: Anonymous
content:
Sa dami ng araw na ako'y naghintay,
Sa mundo ng gulo at walang kapayapaan,
Ikaw ang dumating, tahimik ang yapak,
Ngunit ang puso ko’y agad mong niyakap.

Parang umaga sa gitna ng gabi,
Liwanag mong taglay, sa dilim ay tangi.
Hindi ko inaasahan, hindi ko hiniling,
Ngunit ikaw ang sagot sa dasal kong lihim.

Sa bawat ngiti mo, gumagaan ang mundo,
Sa bawat titig mo, tila humihinto ang oras ko.
Ang tinig mong mahina, musika sa pandinig,
Ang bawat salita mo’y payapa at mahimbing.

Hindi ka lang basta ganda sa paningin,
Pati kaluluwa mo, may gintong ningning.
Lahat ng hapdi, agad mong pinawi,
Parang ulan sa tagtuyot ng aking pagkatao’t damdamin.

Sa bawat yakap mo, tahan ang puso ko,
Sa piling mo'y tunay, buo ang pagkatao ko.
Ikaw ang tahanan sa mundo kong pagod,
Ang pahinga sa bawat laban kong malupit at lubos.

Hindi ko man masukat sa salita o tula,
Ang halaga mong taglay sa puso kong aba.
Ang mundo'y magulo, ngunit ikaw ay payapa,
Isang hiwagang hindi kailanman mawawala.

Sa iyong pagdating, lahat ay nag-iba,
Bawat kulay naging mas matingkad pa.
Ikaw ang bahagharing sa ulan ko'y lumitaw,
Sa bawat lungkot, ikaw ang sagot at galak.

Hindi ko kailanman kayang pantayan,
Ang biyaya mong dulot sa araw-araw.
Minsan iniisip ko kung anong ginawa,
Upang makamit ang isang gaya mong dakila.

Kung panaginip man ito, huwag na akong gisingin,
Kung ito'y isang kwento, huwag na itong tapusin.
Ikaw ang pahina ng buhay kong kay gulo,
Na naging dahilan ng aking pagbabago.

Kaya’t salamat, sinta, sa iyong pagdating,
Ikaw ang pinakamagandang nangyari sa akin.
Sa bawat tibok ng puso kong umiibig,
Pangalan mo lang ang tanging iniibig.

title: Itaas ng Buhay
author: Anonymous
content:
Sa silid na tahimik, ikaw ang liwanag,
Laging may dalang tanong at sagot na tiyak.
May libro sa palad, ngunit mata’y malayo,
Tila ba sa akin laging may tanong na bago.

Ako’y laging nasa ulap, sinisid ang langit,
Lumulutang sa ulap ngunit ikaw ang iniisip.
Sa bawat pagbalik, ikaw ang hinahanap,
Tahimik mong ngiti ang aking pangarap.

Isang araw, sa ilalim ng araw na kay linaw,
Magkakasalubong tayo sa oras na payapa’t bughaw.
Ako’y pagod ngunit may ngiting taglay,
Dahil alam kong sa’yo ako uuwi ng buo at buháy.

May papel kang hawak, tinta ng kaalaman,
Ako’y may tala, mga ruta ng daan.
Ngunit sa gitna ng gulo ng bawat propesyon,
Tayo pa rin ang tanong at sagot ng panahon.

Tahimik kang nagtuturo, habang ako’y nakikinig,
Sa pagitan ng araw at ulap, ikaw ang aking init.
Wala nang palakpakan, wala nang anunsyo,
Ikaw lang ang dulo ng bawat aking paglayo.

May bitbit kang tsokolate, ako nama’y kape,
Sa abalang araw, tayo'y may sariling mundo’t sikreto.
May hikaw kang kumikislap, ako'y nakayuko,
Dahil kahit kailan, ikaw pa rin ang paborito ko.

Hindi mo na kailangang tawagin ang aking pangalan,
Dahil sa tibok ng puso ko'y ikaw ang laman.
At kahit pa ako’y bihasa sa disiplina’t sukat,
Sa'yo ako'y bata, laging nagugulat.

Ang mundo ay umikot, ngunit tayo’y nanatili,
Sa bawat taon, mas lalong naging buo’t tangi.
Ang kamay mong marahan, gabay sa landas ko,
At ang tinig mong banayad, himig ng puso ko.

Sa mga pader na puno ng pangarap at alaala,
Nandoon ang kwento nating kay ganda.
Ako’y tagapagsalaysay, ikaw ang diwa,
Tayong dalawa ang nagsulat ng tadhana.

May mga araw na tila ako’y alon,
Habang ikaw ang pampang—hindi kailanman matinag.
At sa bawat pagsubok, ikaw ang tahanan,
Sa’yo ako babalik, sa’yo ako mananatili.

Ang suklay mong puti, ako’y naka-uniporme,
Ngunit sa puso ko’y tayo’y magka-uniporme.
Dahil sa bawat araw na ako’y lumalayo,
Ikaw pa rin ang pinipiling mundo.

Kahit ilang beses pa akong lumipad,
Ang yakap mo pa rin ang hanap-hanap.
At sa bawat pahina ng iyong talaan,
Nandoon ang ngalan ko, sinusulat nang may pagmamahal.

Hindi na natin kailangang ipakita,
Ang tagumpay na dati lang pangarap pa.
Dahil sapat na ang mga mata mong nagniningning,
Upang ako’y sumuko sa pagmamahal mong walang alinlangan.

Tayong dalawa, sa mundo ng kaalaman at paglalakbay,
Sa gitna ng alon, ulap, at panibagong araw.
Hindi na tayo nagsisimula, ngunit patuloy pa rin,
Dahil sa pag-ibig, walang katapusan ang atin.

Kaya't sa araw na bumaba na ang ulap sa lupa,
At ang tisa'y humimlay sa tabi ng tala,
Tayo'y di lang kwento ng propesyon at tagumpay,
Tayo'y kwento ng dalawang pusong sabay ang paglalakbay.

title: Until White Outgrows Black
author: Anonymous
content:
I do not come with fleeting flame,
Nor winds that pass and shift their name.
My vow is not for seasons brief,
But carved through joy, through pain, through grief.

I do not seek the four-month dance,
Of lovers caught in transient chance.
I am the root beneath the tree,
That clings through storms, unbendingly.

I am not here for summer's hue,
Then vanish when the cold winds blew.
My soul is set, my mind is sure—
To build a life that shall endure.

I’ve looked beyond the shallow fire,
That burns in haste, then soon expires.
I choose instead the endless spark,
That lights the night and warms the dark.

For I have seen in you the sun,
That does not set when day is done.
Your gaze has depth, your voice has grace,
And in your arms I’ve found my place.

I see you not as passing tide,
But as the sea where I reside.
Not just a kiss to mark a day,
But lips I’ll age beside and pray.

We'll rise each dawn in weathered peace,
In whispered touch, in love’s increase.
Your hands shall hold the time-worn years,
And wipe away both joy and tears.

We'll build not castles made of sand,
But homes with stone by patient hand.
Through every roof that leaks with rain,
We’ll fix it close, not flee the strain.

When beauty fades and bodies change,
When time has bent our forms to strange,
My arms shall still know how to find,
The heart you gave, the loyal mind.

There’ll be no other, nor a shift,
No second glance, no wandering drift.
My oath is iron, sealed in bone,
To walk beside you, you alone.

Not till it’s hard or till it's dull,
Not till the cup is less than full—
But even when it's cracked and bare,
Together still, and still we care.

When wrinkles map across your face,
And memory slows its hurried pace,
I'll kiss each fold as sacred line,
The living script of love divine.

We’ll garden slow with trembling hands,
Still dreaming of our younger plans.
And even if they all fall through,
The dream that matters is still you.

Through every dusk, through every year,
I’ll call you home, and keep you near.
When all the world forgets your name,
My love shall burn without a shame.

You are not one to pass me by,
But she for whom I breathe and die.
The bride I’ll hold with trembling vow,
The one I’ve chosen, then and now.

Our bed shall not be just for lust,
But hallowed ground of sacred trust.
Where prayers are whispered in the night,
And fears are soothed with morning light.

We'll laugh at things we laughed before,
Though weaker knees touch colder floor.
For joy, when shared, will stretch and bend,
And shape our love until the end.

Even when silence claims our days,
And words come slow in fog and haze,
Your eyes will speak, and mine will hear—
For love grown old still draws us near.

No farewell clause, no date to leave,
No selfish will, no plan to grieve.
I’m not a chapter in your book,
But every page you’ll ever look.

I’ll walk with you through children's cries,
And sit beside as stillness lies.
From youth’s bright bloom to elder gray,
I’ll love you not just for a day.

Not just for peak, not only climb,
But also in decline of time.
In every hour love may require,
I’ll feed its flame, rebuild the fire.

When cane in hand becomes our guide,
And pace slows down where once we’d stride,
Still side by side, through shade and shine,
Your wrinkled hand shall rest in mine.

When birthdays come with fewer guests,
And quiet speaks where laughter rests,
Still I shall bake your favorite sweet,
And kiss your lips when hearts still beat.

In church pews old, where hymns are slow,
We’ll hum the songs from long ago.
And though our voices shake and fall,
Still harmony will crown it all.

The fights we had will lose their sting,
Forgiveness now our offering.
For time will show what passion can’t:
That love is learned, not merely chanced.

When children grown have flown and gone,
And empty rooms stare out till dawn,
Still we’ll have tales, and we’ll have tea,
And memories of just you and me.

At last when breath begins to fade,
And limbs grow tired from roads we made,
I’ll hold your face and whisper low:
“It’s time, my love, but I won’t go.”

I’ll follow you beyond this land,
And hold you still with ghostly hand.
For death may try, but shall not part,
What heaven wrote upon the heart.

So let the world its judgments send,
Our story starts, but does not end.
I’ll marry you not just for show—
But till the grave, and still below.

So trust in this, my one, my vow,
Not just for what is easy now.
I stay to build, to fight, to stay,
Till all that’s left is love—and clay.

title: At your service, master
author: Anonymous
content:
I’m sorry for the words I threw,
When tempers flared and silence grew.
For every glance that felt too cold,
For love I paused, instead of told.
You didn’t deserve those broken days.

I ache for all the nights you cried,
For every time I turned aside.
If I could take the sharp back in,
I'd trade them all for where we’ve been—
And never raise my voice again.

I see now where I failed to bend,
Where ego bloomed, and pride wouldn’t end.
But I am learning, slow and clear,
That love means listening through the fear,
Not winning, but just being near.

You matter more than being right,
Than claiming ground or picking fights.
I vow to soften every edge,
To hold you close and not the grudge,
To walk with peace, not war, each night.

I can’t erase what I have done,
But I can grow, beneath the sun.
This heart is yours to shape, to guide—
No more defense, no more false pride.
Just me, and love, and hands held tight.

title: Unmonotoned
author: Anonymous
content:
My days were gray, a hollow stream,
Where silence held the weight of dream.
Each hour passed without a name,
Each night and morn both felt the same.
But then you came, and skies were flame.

You brushed the dark with light anew,
And painted stillness shades of you.
The world, once hushed in bitter tones,
Now hums with joy I call my own.
The rhythm shifts when hearts are known.

You bloomed where once no flower dared,
And every glance said, 'Someone cared.'
The coldest parts inside my chest,
Found warmth in you, and needed rest,
My soul unchained, no more suppressed.

Your laughter spilled like morning rain,
It washed away the hidden pain.
Where I saw only black and white,
You placed a prism in my sight,
And gave me dawn in place of night.

You taught my heart to dance, to feel,
To cherish joy that once felt steel.
Now even silence holds your trace,
A palette drawn across my days,
Each moment richer in your grace.

I do not miss the life before,
For now there's depth I can’t ignore.
Where once I walked, now I can fly,
With every step, I reach the sky,
Because of you, who passed me by.

A world once dim now burns so bright,
With every hue that you ignite.
Your love, the artist, bold and true,
And I, the canvas shaped by you,
Forever marked by all you do.

title: Night of Mine
author: Anonymous
content:
The stars can fall, the sky can fade,
But still I’ll stand, unafraid.
For when I see your eyes so true,
I know I’m home, I’m safe with you.

You walked in quiet, changed the air,
With every breath, I knew you’d care.
And in your voice, a world begins,
Where love is full, and time still spins.

I never dreamed of something more,
Till you knocked gently on my door.
And now this heart, once lost in gray,
Beats just for you, night and day.

Oh, I will hold you close and near,
Through every joy, through every tear.
I’ll stay beside you, strong and kind,
No fear ahead, no past behind.

Even if years may come and go,
Even if storms may steal the glow,
You’ll always be my only light,
My heart’s one flame, my soul’s delight.

No diamond shines the way you do,
No gold compares to loving you.
You’re every prayer I used to say,
Now answered bright, in full display.

So if you ask me why I stay,
Why I still choose you every day—
It’s 'cause your love makes life complete,
It’s you who makes my silence sweet.

I’ll write your name in skies above,
In whispered vows, in songs of love.
And every beat this heart will make,
Will sing your name until it breaks.

You’re not just someone passing through,
You are the dream I always knew.
And if the world would end tonight,
I’d still be full—your hand in mine.

For love like this is not by chance,
It’s born in fate, in quiet dance.
You are the start, the end, the way,
The melody I’ll always play.

So when I see you dressed in grace,
And tears fall slowly down your face,
I’ll whisper softly, full of pride,
“I’ve loved you every step, every tide.”

And when they ask me why I smile,
I’ll point to you and pause awhile.
No words could match what I have found,
In you, where all my hopes are bound.

You're not just beauty, not just light,
You're my forever, my every right.
And here I stand, my soul in flight,
Loving only you, tonight.

So take this vow, as soft as air,
That I will always, always care.
And if this life should pass us through,
Know I was born to love just you.

Now as the music fades away,
One truth will linger, come what may:
No sweeter love, no purer sight—
Than you, my love, my only light.

title: Sa Imo Lang Ako
author: Anonymous
content:
Sa sulod sang uniporme ko, nagatindog ako nga husto,
Pero sa imo tubangan, ginahalin ko ang pagkahusto.
Isip isa ka sundalo sang respeto kag kusog,
Pero ikaw lang ang makaubos sang akon bilog.

Ang botones nga nagapilit sa akon dughan,
Ginakalipay ko nga ikaw ang makatigbaw sang tanan.
Pirme ko ginahandum ang imo mga palad,
Nga maglabay sa akon nawong, halok nga matam-is.

Sa itom nga Amerikana, sa kalo nga elegante,
Apang sa imo presensya, ginahalin ko ang pagka-arrogante.
Isa lang ka tingog halin sa imo nga mga bibig,
Magahapa ko, magahulag nga wala sang kabig.

Ginapasul-ob ko ang sinul-ob nga pormal,
Apang ginahandong ang pagkahubo sang normal.
Subong sang isa ka alipin nga matinumanon,
Sa imo mga pulong, wala ko ginaatrasan.

Sa malaba nga gabi, sa mga pulong nga makahidlawan,
Ginapabatsyag ko sa imo ang akon pagkahinay.
Isip isa ka lalake nga ginatipigan ang dangal,
Pero ginahalin ko ini sa imo sulod sang kwarto sang balatyagon.

Isa ka halok lang sa imo mga kamot,
Magaubos sang bug-os ko nga gahum kag buot.
Sa ilalum sang pormal nga panapton nga ginahambog,
Ikaw lang ang kabalo magguba sang akon hulbot.

Ang mga korbata nga ginasuksok ko pirmi,
Ginapahangop ko nga ikaw lang ang gusto ko permi.
Isa ka halok sa liog, isa ka pahiyum nga may kahulugan,
Nagahimu sang adlaw ko nga may kalipay.

Indi ko na mahulat ang adlaw nga kita lang,
Nga sa sulod sang kwarto, indi ko na magpugong.
Ang uniform ko nga ginadala ko nga may dungog,
Imo lang ang ginapasakop ko, wala sang luglog.

Sa imo mga mata nagapakita sang kahulugan,
Nga bisan sin-o pa ko sa guwa sang balay,
Sa sulod sang aton ginatamyo nga kalibutan,
Isa lang ko ka lalaki nga imo ginapalipay.

Ginadala ko ang medalya, ang dungog sang trabaho,
Pero sa imo kilid, isa ko lang ka tawo.
Nga handa magpahamtang sang kaugalingon,
Subong sang subservient nga matinumanon.

Sa mga kagab-ihon nga indi ko ka hulat,
Ginapangamuyo ko nga ikaw ang akon makaupod.
Ang panapton ko ginadula ko sa kahayag,
Nga ikaw lang ang kabalo magpanginbulahan.

Bisan may mga tawo nga nagahambal sa akon,
Nga dapat magpabilin ako nga matinahuron.
Pero sa imo lang ako gusto magpasakop,
Ang bug-os ko nga pagkatawo, imo lang himo-on.

Sa tago nga kwarto, ikaw ang reyna,
Ako ang imo masunuron, wala sang lain pa.
Isa lang ko ka sundalo nga wala sang armas,
Kung indi ang gugma ko nga wala sang puas.

Ini ang akon kamatuoran nga ginapalab-ot,
Nga sa imo lang ko gusto maghulbot.
Ang uniporme ko pwede ko biyaan,
Basta ikaw lang ang akon palangga kag ginahandum.

title: A Morning Just for You
author: Anonymous
content:
Each morning as the sun will rise,
Before the light can touch your eyes,
I’ll be within our little space,
Preparing joy you’ll soon embrace.

The kitchen hums with gentle grace,
As I imagine your soft face.
The scent of coffee, warm and true,
Will be my whispered 'I love you.'

A plate of eggs, a buttered toast,
The meals you seem to love the most.
A simple task, yet deeply dear,
To feed the one I hold so near.

I’ll stir the pot with patient hand,
While thinking of where we will stand.
Through time and life, through thick and thin,
I’ll cook for love, again, again.

Perhaps some mornings we will fight,
Yet still, I’ll cook to make it right.
An omelette kissed with earnest care,
A truce in food, love in the air.

When busy days may pull you fast,
I'll make each breakfast one to last.
A ritual of humble art,
To hold you close before we part.

With every flip of pancake round,
My vow of love again is found.
To nourish more than body’s need,
But heart and soul through every deed.

And should the years grow silver gray,
Still I will cook for you each day.
With hands more worn, with eyes more wise,
Still full of love, beneath the skies.

So let me be your morning sun,
Before the busy world’s begun.
To serve you food, to serve you grace,
And always see your glowing face.

I’ll rise with stars not yet in flight,
And greet your soul with pure delight.
For you, my love, I’ll cook and stay,
To start with joy our every day.

The kettle sings, the moments glow,
A lifetime’s love in cups to show.
For in each bite and sip you take,
A promise lies I’ll never break.

The clock may race, the years may fly,
But cooking still, for you and I,
Will be my vow in dawn’s soft hue—
Each morning, I will cook for you.

So when you wake and find me there,
With humble food and endless care,
Know that this act, though small it seems,
Is made of love, of hopes and dreams.

Each morning’s meal, each day anew,
Will sing the words, "I love you true."
For every dawn, while skies are blue,
I want to cook... just for you.

title: Kalikasan Nating Dalawa
author: Anonymous
content:
Parang bulaklak at bubuyog,
Tayo'y sabay sa pagyabong.
Ikaw ang kulay sa mundo ko,
Ako'y gabay sa paglipad mo.

Parang punong nagbibigay lilim,
Ako'y tahanan mo sa init.
Sa bawat sanga ng yakap ko,
Ikaw ang dahong sumasayaw rito.

Tubig na dumadaloy sa sapa,
Ikaw ang ilog na pinagmulan.
Ako'y agos na sumusunod,
Sa bawat galaw mo'y nalulunod.

Sa pag-ikot ng araw at buwan,
Sabay tayong tumitibay.
Ako'y hangin sa iyong paligid,
Ikaw ang apoy na nagbibigay init.

Parang ulap sa himpapawid,
Ako'y ulan sa iyong paligid.
Sa tuwing uhaw ka sa lambing,
Ako'y patak ng halik sa iyong pisngi.

Gaya ng bituin sa gabi,
Ikaw ang ilaw sa dilim.
Ako'y gabi na yumayakap,
Nagbibigay tahimik sa iyong paligid.

Parang dagat na walang hanggan,
Ako'y alon na sumusunod.
Hindi kailanman mapapagod,
Sa bawat haplos ko sa iyo.

Ikaw ang araw sa umaga,
Ako'y hamog na nagbabadya.
Kasabay ng bawat pagsikat mo,
Ako'y yakap na sumasalubong sa'yo.

Parang lupa at halaman,
Ako'y sustansya mong kailangan.
Sa bawat pagdampi ng pag-ibig,
Tayo'y sabay na lalago at sasaya.

Ganito tayo, ikaw at ako,
Magkatuwang sa pag-inog ng mundo.
Sa bawat ugnay nating dalawa,
Mutualismo sa pag-ibig at saya.

title: Meeting at Night
author: Robert Browning

title: Tonight I Can Write
author: Pablo Neruda
content:
Tonight I can write the saddest lines.

Write, for example, 'The night is starry
and the blue stars shiver in the distance.'

The night wind revolves in the sky and sings.

Tonight I can write the saddest lines.
I loved her, and sometimes she loved me too.

Through nights like this one I held her in my arms.
I kissed her again and again under the endless sky.

She loved me, sometimes I loved her too.
How could one not have loved her great still eyes.

Tonight I can write the saddest lines.
To think that I do not have her. To feel that I have lost her.

To hear the immense night, still more immense without her.
And the verse falls to the soul like dew to the pasture.

What does it matter that my love could not keep her.
The night is starry and she is not with me.

This is all. In the distance someone is singing. In the distance.
My soul is not satisfied that it has lost her.

My sight tries to find her as though to bring her closer.
My heart looks for her, and she is not with me.

The same night whitening the same trees.
We, of that time, are no longer the same.

I no longer love her, that's certain, but how I loved her.
My voice tried to find the wind to touch her hearing.

Another's. She will be another's. As she was before my kisses.
Her voice, her bright body. Her infinite eyes.

I no longer love her, that's certain, but maybe I love her.
Love is so short, forgetting is so long.

Because through nights like this one I held her in my arms
my soul is not satisfied that it has lost her.

Though this be the last pain that she makes me suffer
and these the last verses that I write for her.

title: somewhere i have never travelled
author: E.E. Cummings
content:
somewhere i have never travelled,gladly beyond
any experience,your eyes have their silence:
in your most frail gesture are things which enclose me,
or which i cannot touch because they are too near

your slightest look easily will unclose me
though i have closed myself as fingers,
you open always petal by petal myself as Spring opens
(touching skilfully,mysteriously)her first rose

or if your wish be to close me, i and
my life will shut very beautifully ,suddenly,
as when the heart of this flower imagines
the snow carefully everywhere descending;

nothing which we are to perceive in this world equals
the power of your intense fragility:whose texture
compels me with the color of its countries,
rendering death and forever with each breathing

(i do not know what it is about you that closes
and opens;only something in me understands
the voice of your eyes is deeper than all roses)
nobody,not even the rain,has such small hands

title: Having a Coke with You
author: Frank O'Hara
content:
is even more fun than going to San Sebastian, Irún, Hendaye, Biarritz, Bayonne
or being sick to my stomach on the Travesera de Gracia in Barcelona
partly because in your orange shirt you look like a better happier St. Sebastian
partly because of my love for you, partly because of your love for yoghurt
partly because of the fluorescent orange tulips around the birches
partly because of the secrecy our smiles take on before people and statuary
it is hard to believe when I'm with you that there can be anything as still
as solemn as unpleasantly definitive as statuary when right in front of it
in the warm New York 4 o'clock light we are drifting back and forth
between each other like a tree breathing through its spectacles

and the portrait show seems to have no faces in it at all, just paint
you suddenly wonder why in the world anyone ever did them

I look
at you and I would rather look at you than all the portraits in the world
except possibly for the Polish Rider occasionally and anyway it's in the Frick
which thank heavens you haven't gone to yet so we can go together the first time
and the fact that you move so beautifully more or less takes care of Futurism
just as at home I never think of the Nude Descending a Staircase or
at a rehearsal a single drawing of Leonardo or Michelangelo that used to wow me
and what good does all the research of the Impressionists do them
when they never got the right person to stand near the tree when the sun sank
or for that matter Marino Marini when he didn't pick the rider as carefully
as the horse

it seems they were all cheated of some marvellous experience
which is not going to go wasted on me which is why I am telling you about it
